descr: "Indicates that a medication product is to be or has been dispensed for a named person/patient.  This includes a description of the medication product (supply) provided and the instructions for administering the medication.  The medication dispense is the result of a pharmacy system responding to a medication order."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a MedicationDispense resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR."

fields.name: partOf
fields.descr: "The procedure that the dispense is done because of."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events."

fields.name: _status
fields.descr: "Extensions for status"

fields.name: category
fields.descr: "Indicates type of medication dispense and where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered."

fields.name: medicationCodeableConcept
fields.descr: "Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications."

fields.name: medicationReference
fields.descr: "Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event."

fields.name: supportingInformation
fields.descr: "Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed."

fields.name: performer
fields.descr: "Indicates who or what performed the event.  It should be assumed that the performer is the dispenser of the medication."

fields.name: authorizingPrescription
fields.descr: "Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc."

fields.name: quantity
fields.descr: "The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure."

fields.name: daysSupply
fields.descr: "The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount."

fields.name: whenPrepared
fields.descr: "The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed."

fields.name: _whenPrepared
fields.descr: "Extensions for whenPrepared"

fields.name: whenHandedOver
fields.descr: "The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative."

fields.name: _whenHandedOver
fields.descr: "Extensions for whenHandedOver"

fields.name: destination
fields.descr: "Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event."

fields.name: receiver
fields.descr: "Identifies the person who picked up the medication.  This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes."

fields.name: dosageInstruction
fields.descr: "Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient."

fields.name: substitution
fields.descr: "Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense.  In some cases substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen.  This block explains what substitution did or did not happen and why.  If nothing is specified, substitution was not done."

fields.name: detectedIssue
fields.descr: "Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc."

fields.name: notDone
fields.descr: "True if the dispense was not performed for some reason."

fields.name: _notDone
fields.descr: "Extensions for notDone"

fields.name: notDoneReasonCodeableConcept
fields.descr: "Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed."

fields.name: notDoneReasonReference
fields.descr: "Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed."

fields.name: eventHistory
fields.descr: "A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
